Sentencas: The effect of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode thickness, porosity, pore size, and pore tortuosity on fuel and exhaust gas flow is calculated.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: Also determined is the concentration of these gases and of diluent gases as a function of position across the anode.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: The calculation is based on the dusty-gas model which includes a Knudsen (molecule-wall) collision term in the Stefan-Maxwell equation which is based on unlike-molecule collisions.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: Commonly made approximations are avoided in order to obtain more exact results.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: One such approximation is the assumption of uniform total gas pressure across the anode.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: Another such approximation is the assumption of zero fuel gas concentration at the anode-electrolyte interface under the anode saturation condition for which the SOFC output voltage goes to zero.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: Elimination of this approximation requires use of a model we developed (published elsewhere) for terminal voltage V as a function of electrolyte current density i. Key formulae from this model are presented.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: The formulae developed herein for gas flow and tortuosity are applied to the results of a series of careful experiments performed by another group, who used binary and ternary gas mixtures on the anode side of an SOFC.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: Our values for tortuosity are in a physically reasonable low range, from 1.7 to 3.3.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: They are in fair agreement with those obtained by the other group, once a difference in nomenclature is taken into account.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: This difference consists in their definition of tortuosity being what some call tortuosity factor, which is the square of what we and some others call tortuosity.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates

Sentencas: The results emphasize the need for careful design of anode pore structures, especially in anode-supported SOFCs which require thicker anodes.
Titulo: Anode-pore tortuosity in solid oxide fuel cells found from gas and current flow rates
